Priyanka Gandhi.description: RAE BARELI: In her scathing attack on BJP and Modi government, Congress general secretary Priyanka Gandhi said that Congress doesn't need any certificate from anyone to prove its nationalist feelings. "Ye brashtachar ki baat karnewale sabse bade brashta hain… kaam ki baat karte hain magar sabse bade nikamme hain… dharma ki baat karne wale sabse bada adharm kar rahe hain - dharm ka istemal kar rahe hain… saheedon ka istemal kar rahe hain - sirf rajinit ke liye (They are talking of acting against corruption but are corrupt themselves… they talk of work but are good for nothing… they talk of dharma (read duties) but indulge in adharma by defying its norms - they use religion and martyrs for political interests)," Priyanka stated in her closed door meeting with cadres on Thursday. The Congress leader hit out at BJP's strategy of playing the nationalist card. "We are Congress… we launched the freedom movement… gave our blood and sweat… braved British atrocities … we don't need any certificate to prove our nationalist feelings especially from the ones who apologised to the British at that time", asserted Priyanka, urging the workers to go to every household in their area and meet every voter. She directed the workers to apprise the voters that the 2019 Lok Sabha election was as important as the freedom movement. Infusing energy in them she said, "Don't be afraid of anything as this is a weak government. Only a weak government curbs the voice of the people, which is a crime in democracy." Priyanka asked the workers to stand up for their leader whose only dream is the progress of India and its people. "Rahul thinks of the people without any vested interest," Priyanka said citing the example of her conversation with Rahul on the issue of using self-help group women for campaigning. "When I proposed to him this idea, he simply denied… saying that I created the SHGs to empower women, not use them in any way," Priyanka said quoting her brother. The Congress general secretary told the workers that she was working on mission 2022. "We will, with your support, form the government in 2022. And once we come, we will stay here for long on the basis of our hard work," she said adding that the hard-workers would be adequately rewarded. Summer Season.description: NEW DELHI: Google on Friday celebrated the longest day of the year in Northern Hemisphere by dedicating a doodle. Also called summer solstice, or midsummer, the longest day occurs when one of the Earth's poles has its maximum tilt toward the Sun. What: The longest day (and shortest night) of the year in the Northern Hemisphere. When: Today (June 21). Technically, the solstice occurs when the sun is directly over the imaginary Tropic of Cancer or 23.5°N latitude. In 2019, this will occur at 3:54 pm GMT on Friday (or 9:24 pm IST). Why: The term 'solstice' comes from Latin —'sol' means sun and 'sistere' means to stand still. How: The 23.4° tilt in the Earth's axis causes varying amounts of sunlight to reach different regions during its year-long orbit around the Sun. Today, the North Pole is tipped more towards the Sun than on any other day of the year. However, that does not mean more heat or that the Earth is any closer to the Sun, per common misconceptions. Which: Summer solstices happen twice each year (once in each hemisphere). Summer solstice for the Northern Hemisphere = Winter solstice for the Southern Hemisphere, and vice-versa. Also, during Equinoxes (vernal and autumnal), the Sun shines directly on the Equator and the length of day and night are nearly equal in either hemisphere. Key dates for 2019 (Northern Hemisphere)Spring Equinox: Wednesday, March 20 Summer Solstice: Friday, June 21 Autumn Equinox: Monday, September 23 Winter Solstice: Sunday, December 22 FYI: The longest day of the year was the reason why Narendra Modi chose June 21 as the International Day of Yoga. 4 Lucknow University professors teach 4.description: LUCKNOW: Lucknow University authorities on Thursday caught four professors who were enrolled as permanent faculties in two colleges. The anomalies were detected when the two colleges uploaded the details of their teachers on the University Data Resource Centre portal of LU. While checking the faculty details of 165 affiliated colleges, LU officials found four names whose subject, names, photographs and other details were the same as mentioned by another college. "The two self-finance colleges affiliated to LU, one near Maal and other on Sultanpur Road, had the same professor teaching the same subjects. The details uploaded by the two colleges had the same person teaching Hindi, home science, sociology and education at both places at the same time. Even the year of joining was the same," said registrar SK Shukla. "Showcause notices have been issued to the two colleges and four professors. It is being probed whether the fraud was done by the colleges or the professors," Shukla added. He said that no immediate action has been taken against the professors or the colleges considering the fact that at times a professor switches from one college to another then his/her name is not updated in the records. "We will also find out if these professors were drawing salaries from both the colleges," the registrar said.  "If colleges, professors or both would be found guilty then LU will be publicize their names on its official website and take strict action against them." In January last year, LU had directed all colleges to upload faculty detail on the University Data Resource Centre portal but various colleges uploaded the information only after being issued repeated warnings. LU officials said these two colleges, too, uploaded the faculty details after several warnings. Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

\nIla Arun and KK Raina bring the house.description: The Cultural Department of Uttar Pradesh organized an event with the play Namaste Jai Shree Krishna staged at the Sangeet Natak Akademi, recently. The event saw all the theatre lovers and theatre veterans from the city come to watch it. Veteran theatre artists Ila Arun and KK Raina flew from Mumbai to perform in the play. The who’s who of the city, including OP Singh, DGP, UP, along with Dr Hari Om, IAS and Poornima Pandey, Director SNA and secretary Rubeena Baig were at SNA to enjoy the evening.  Gopal Sinha & Poornima Pandey and Surya Mohan Kulshreshtha (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  (L-R) Suchi Sahu, Pankaj and Col BK Prasad (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  (L-R) Malvika and Dr Hariom , Mini Bajpayee (L) and Neerja Shukla (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  (L-R) Neelika, Sangeeta Jaiswal, Nehi & Sameer Agarwal (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  Pradeep Kapoor and Ila Kapoor with RKS Rathore and Sushma Rathore (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  Rakhi Kishore (L) & Geeta Singh, Rachita Vyas (L) & Shamita Joshi (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal)  Rakesh Chandra (L) and Ajay Jain and Tarun Raj and Archna (BCCL/ Vishnu Jaiswal) Adapted from Tom Dudzick’s play of the name Greetings! the story revolved around the contradictions in a family when the son brings home his girlfriend of a different culture and dialect, and the problem faced by the son in hiding the fact the girl is his girlfriend. Written and directed by Ila Arun and KK Raina, the play had the audience in splits with them creating magic with their chemistry on stage. — Saad Abbasi Download The Times of India News App for Latest City .

Etawah hosp: Doc stitches wounds in mobi.description: KANPUR: A video rapidly doing the rounds in the city is of an incident in the operation theatre (OT) of Etawah’s Bhimrao Ambedkar hospital where two patients’ injuries are being stitched up under the thin beam of mobile phone torches held aloft by the patients’ families. There was no power, sources said, adding the hospital’s three generator sets are usually non-functional due to lack of fuel. Rahul and Sunil, both residents of Hiranpur village under Ekdil police jurisdiction in Etawah, sustained head injuries, hospital sources said, following a clash between two groups on Wednesday and were brought to the hospital, among Etawah’s oldest and largest government hospitals. As the hospital had no power, the doctor on duty stitched their wounds with relatives focusing mobile flashlights on the bleeding duo. “As power went off briefly and the generator was not working, I wasted no time to stitch up and bandage their wounds,” said Dr Jaydesh Yadav. Hospital chief medical superintendent (CMS) Dr S S Bhadauria confirmed the incident but said “it is not a routine affair”. “This happened on Wednesday at around 6 pm. Power supply was disrupted due to heavy rain. In the meantime, two patients arrived with head injuries. To provide immediate relief to the patients who were in pain and bleeding profusely, Dr Jaydesh treated them in the light of mobile torches,” Dr Bhadauria informed TOI on Thursday, denying the claim by hospital insiders that the generators “never work”. Lots of dancing at this wedding in Luckn.description: The wedding ceremony of Anshul Mittal and Dickey Dolma was a resplendent event. Many prominent people of the city marked their presence at the event including theatre veterans Dr Anil Rastogi and Surya Mohan Kulshreshtha. The guests indulged in lots of dancing. Some of the peppy Bollywood numbers on which the crowd shook their leg were 'Aankh Maarey', 'Kala Chashma' and 'Coca Cola' among others. — Saad Abbasi  (L) Dr Anil Rastogi (R) Dickey, Tsering and Usha (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  (L) Astha (R) Dinesh Kumar Sahgal and Dr Anita Sahgal Vasundhara (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  (L) Jampal and Munni (R) Pushpa Lata and Jitendra Mittal (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  (L) Tatian Mittal (R) Vilayat Zafri (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav)  Urmil Kumar Thapliyal and Veena (BCCL/ Aditya Yadav) In Video:Lots of dancing at this wedding in LucknowDownload The Times of India News App for Latest City .
